ext_description.p: A AlternatePartRelationship is a type of where the relating part represents the base part and the related part represents the alternate part.

It specifies that any version of the alternate part, may be used in place of any version of the base part, regardless of its usages and of its versions. The relationship established by the AlternatePartRelationship is not symmetric: if part B is an alternate part for part A, part A is not implied to be an alternate part for part B.
ext_description.note: If a part is an alternate for another part, it is understood that there is no interest in keeping track of which part, the base or any alternates specified, is used as a particular instance of the base part within a part structure

An organization may track design changes for a base part, and establish effectivity conditions for the use of that base part in various assemblies to be manufactured. The use of an alternate part implies that an organization does not specify any particular version of the alternate part nor establish effectivities relating to it
An AlternatePartRelationship may relate parts of any kind, provided both related objects identify parts of the same part category.
An AlternatePartRelationship for which the base part is an assembly involves that the entire part structure of the alternate part may be used in place of the base part and its part structure.

This concept usually refers to form, fit, function, and quality. Additional properties such as performance, noise, endurance, or reliability may also be considered as a prerequisite for the replacement
ext_description.example: Two bolts of the same size are parts. One bolt has a square head and the other has a hexagonal head. The two bolts are considered equivalent with respect to form, fit, and function: they both have sufficiently close physical shape, they take up the same space when used, and they both serve to fasten two things together. Thus, one of these two bolts could be considered to be an alternate part for the other bolt.
ext_description.note: The following additional data can be assigned to an AlternatePartRelationship: , , , , , and .

ext_description.p: the word or set of words describing the requirements that are covered by both the base part and the alternate part and therefore are the basis for the statement regarding the capability of replacing the base part by the alternate part.
ext_description.note: Additional properties such as performance, noise, endurance, or reliability may also be considered as a prerequisite for the replacement in addition to form, fit, function, and quality.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the inherited attribute relationType. The value of relationType shall be 'alternate'.
The combination of the related part and the relating part shall be unique.

A BeveledSheetRepresentation is a type of that has a significant thickness, and whose edge is beveled at a constant angle around its entire perimeter. It is an extension of the concept of a thin sheet to products, such as honeycomb core, that have significant thickness but can be formed to mate with a curved surface.
specifies the angle from the plane normal to the defining surface of part's profile to the beveled surface.
specifies the base exterior boundary and defining surface of the part.
specifies the vertical height of the part's profile from the base boundary to where the bevel begins.
ensure that the units for angle and length are correct.

A BoundaryCurveRepresentation is a set of curves that define the sheet edge. These curves define a closed area but are not necessarily restrained topologically. The curves that encompass the other curves are the outer boundary, while curves that define a closed area within the outer boundary are cutouts.

ext_description.p:
A CentreOfMass is a type of
that is the centre of the mass of a body. The relative position of the CentreOfMass within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation. The CentreOfMass is a characteristic of a part, not its shape.
ext_description.note: If a shape representation is present, the CentreOfMass is usually derivable from the shape representation. However, as a characteristic of a part, it may be pre-defined in order to reflect a requirement.

In order to convey the information about the actual centre of mass of a geometric model, the use of
with value 'centroid' for its attribute
is appropriate.

ext_description.p: A Class is a classification of an object which characterizes all objects of the same kind; such a classification is independent from the application of the classified object.
ext_description.example: A fastener with subclasses, such as fastener with 2 or 3 fixture holes, a bracket with subclasses, e.g., with 90 or 100 degrees bending angle, or screws with subclasses such as metal screws or machine screws are examples for Class.

example.p: For facilitating an effective part retrieval for slotted screws, several Class objects may be defined to classify screws:

ul.li: A Class *1 with description 'slotted screws' and three subclasses with the descriptions *2: 'slotted cheese head screws - product grade A', *3: 'slotted pan head screws - product grade A', and *4: 'slotted countersunk flat head screws - product grade A'.

Each of the Class objects is based on a Class that further defines where the definition of the Class comes from. For Class *1 this is a company internal for 'screw classes'. For the other Class objects these are ISO standardized objects, namely for *2 'ISO 1207', for *3 'ISO 1580', and for *4 'ISO 2010'.

The Class objects may be characterized further by objects. According to ISO 1207, the Class *2 has the attributes *11 with id 'd' and description 'thread', *12 with id 'l' and description 'nominal length', *13 with id 'mechanical properties' and description 'property class', etc. The possible values 'M1.6', 'M2', ..., 'M10' for *11 may be defined as objects in a set of the attribute . The according specification is given as of the AO . The refer as their definition to a with the 'nominal metric thread diameter'.

To identify the designation 'Cheese head screw ISO 1207 - M5 x 20 x 4.8', a subclass of Class *2 is defined with the same description and classification source and the description 'slotted cheese head screws ISO 1207 -M5 x 20 x 4.8' but with the values for Class_attribute corresponding to *11 restricted to 'M5' only, i.e., to get just the M5 screws, corresponding to *12 restricted to value '20' only, and corresponding to *13 restricted to value '4.8' only (for steel according to ISO 898-1 [7]).

A CompositeAssembly is a type of that is made of multiple materials that are bonded together. A CompositeAssembly may be made from any combination of materials. A completed CompositeAssembly need not be a rigid shape. A CompositeAssembly may also be used as a composite part.

A CompositeAssemblySequenceDefinition is a single unique sequence or layer within a . The sequence or layer contains one or more constituent parts. When more than one constituent part resides in the same sequence or layer, the constituents must not overlap. If constituents do overlap they must be put on separate sequence or layers.
specifies the collection of components in a single unique sequence or layer in a part. The componentsInSequence shall be a collection of one or more of the types.

A CompositeAssemblyTable is a type of that provides an ordered list of constituent parts. The ordered list provides basic placement position within the laminate (see following figure).
Composite assembly table
specifies the groups of constituents to be laid in sequence. There shall exist not less than two s for the CompositeAssemblyTable.

A CompositeSheetRepresentation is a type of that defines a sheet product. A sheet product is a product whose thickness is constant and small in comparison to its length and width. Most sheet products will conform to the surface on which they are placed. The shape of a sheet product can be represented in a 3-dimensional model of the actual shape, as a shape projected onto the layup surface, or as a shape projected into a 2-dimensional plane. A typical composite sheet is 0.1 to 0.4 millimeters thick while its length and width are much greater than 25 millimeters. A CompositeSheetRepresentation may be one of the following:
,
.
specifies the geometry of the CompositeSheetRepresentation.

A Configuration is a the association of a
or a
object with a design or with a process in order to define a valid usage of it in the context of a certain .
ext_description.note:
The validity of the association may be limited by a time period through assigning an
object to it.
The semantics of the kind of association is defined by the attributes configurationType and inheritanceType.
The following additional data can be assigned to a Configuration: , , , and .

the identifier or set of identifiers for the Configuration.

the classifications of the Configuration.

the valid usage of a Configuration object that is applied to the application object as configuredElement. The following values shall be used:

ul.li:
'design': The object referenced as configuredElementhas to be designed and verified before it can actually be used in a given context. This context is specified by the
and
objects referenced as the isSolutionFor. This type of Configuration is applicable for , , , or
objects;

'usage': The object referenced as the configuredElement is controlled by a Configuration. The
and
objects specify the usage cases and are referenced as the isSolutionFor.

ext_description.p:
This type of Configuration is applicable for , , , , or
objects.
ext_description.example: The presence of an optional third rear axle of a truck is controlled by specifications on the level of .
A 'sunroof' has to be provided, i.e., designed for a class of vehicles that has an optional 'sunroof' as part of its specification.

ext_description.p:
specifies whether or not an inheritance scheme for the configuration information in a hierarchical structure is applied to the application object referenced as the configuredElement. The levels within such a hierarchy are defined through
objects or the attribute
of . The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'exception': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. The value indicates that the configuration information may be inconsistent to the structural levels above it or that it is, on purpose, contradictory to it. Such a condition implies that an inheritance scheme shall not continue beyond this point in the product structure tree

ext_description.example: A situation where the inheritanceType 'exception' is applicable is a technical solution released for one particular customer without support in higher structure levels.

ul.li: 'inherited': A scheme for inheritance of configuration information applies. The complete configuration information shall be collected from the different levels in the structure by evaluation of results. The results shall be evaluated using the logical AND to combine configuration information starting at the referenced configuredElement and using the logical OR to combine alternatives. In addition, this evaluation shall consider related effectivity information. 'inherited' only applies for objects for which the same value of configurationType is defined;

example.p: The following figure shows how inheritance is applied along the tree of a product structure.

The complete configuration information of a
can be obtained by adding any such information to
objects which are linked through
objects and
attributes respectively. Whenever more than one higher level instance is present, the current information available is branched in as many branches as instances are present. For example, the total configuration information for the
given in the figure above could be expressed as follows: (C0.0 AND C1.0 AND C2.0) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.1) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.2).

ul.li: 'local': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. Nevertheless, any potentially inherited configuration information of a higher level shall be consistent, i.e., it shall be a subset of the locally defined configuration information.

ext_description.p: the element that is controlled for its valid usage by the Configuration.

the characteristic or combination of characteristics for which the object referenced as the configuredElement provides a solution or which is needed to control a process operation. These characteristics are defined by a
and combinations of characteristics are defined by a
where the attribute
is 'part usage'.

A ContentProperty is the specification of characteristics precising the content of a or of a . At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a ContentProperty is referred by a , the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case where it is referred by a , the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

ext_description.p: the level of detail that the or the provides. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'rough 3d shape': three-dimensional shape model without edge rounds and fillets;
'rounded edges': three-dimensional shape model with edge rounds and fillets.

ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the kind or kinds of geometry that an object contains. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: '3D wireframe model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in wireframe representation;
'2D shape': The document contains a two-dimensional shape model or contours only;
'surface model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in surface representation;
'closed volume': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in closed body topological surface representation;
'solid model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in advanced boundary representation;
'solid and surface model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in surface and advanced boundary representation;
'assembly': The document contains an assembly structure with reference to the assembled components and their transformation matrices;

'assembly with mating elements': The document contains an assembly structure including the mating components only, such as screws or rivets, with exact positioning information. This assembly representation is intended to be overlayed with the assembly structure for the main components;
'2D drawing': The document contains a technical drawing without three-dimensional shape representation;
'drawing derived from 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that has been derived from a three-dimensional shape model;
'drawing related to 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that visualizes a three-dimensional shape model and possibly establishes associative left to the three-dimensional shape model.

ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A DateAndPersonAssignment is an object that associates a
with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly.
ext_description.example: An example for the requirement stated is that there shall not exist a DateAndPersonAssignment with a role of 'requestor' that refers to a , since this object refers directly to in that role.
ext_description.note: In the context of the object DateAndPersonAssignment, the expression 'referenced object' means 'a concept that is conveyed within one of the instances referred to by the attribute assignedTo and not one of the instances referred to by this attribute.
ext_description.example: If applied to an instance of with role 'creation', the DateAndPersonAssignment specifies the creation date of the part, tool, or raw material as a new object in the activity domain of the organization, and not the creation date of the instance of in the product management system of the organization.

the meaning of the assignment.
Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'additional information': The assigned document provides information that is relevant for the associated object, but is not a description of the associated object itself;
'behaviour': The assigned document specifies information about the behaviour of the associated object;
'description': The assigned document provides textual information for the associated object itself;
'informative': The assigned document may or may not be considered;
'mandatory': The associated object shall conform to the content of the assigned document;
'mathematical description': The assigned document specifies the associated object by providing the algorithmic specification of its behaviour.

'dimensioning standard': The assigned document specifies the dimensioning standard; The document shall be assigned to a . For a there is a textual document assigned, explaining the functionality, size, and other characteristics by a DocumentAssignment with role 'description'. Another document, representing the specification of the , in which the is used, is also assigned to the same by a DocumentAssignment with role 'additional information'.

A DrapedOrientationAngle is a type of that defines a position and direction at a point within a part. The warp direction of a fabric shall be placed in the specified direction prior to draping over the part. Once the fabric has been draped, the orientation angle at any given point must be derived from the draped shape of the fabric. The DrapedOrientationAngle will change in the part if the surface of the part has complex curvature.

ext_description.p: A EventRelationship is a relationship which exists between two objects.
ext_description.example: An instance of this entity data type with relationType 'sequence' may be used to specify that an event shall end before another event starts.

ext_description.p:
the meaning of the relationship.
Where applicable, the following class names shall be used:

ul.li: 'actualization': The relationship specifies that the relating identifies a predicted or planned event and the related identifies the point in time when that event actually occurred. This relationship is valid if the attribute of the relating is not specified and the attribute of the related is specified, or, if both these attributes are specified and equal;

'exclusiveness': The relationship specifies that the relating and the related
shall not have any overlap during their duration;
'sequence': The relationship specifies that the relating shall be completed before the related starts;

'simultaneity': The relationship specifies that both the relating and related are considered as occurring during the same time period or shall be performed together in order to ensure consistency and enhance efficiency. The criteria for 'simultaneity' and in particular the allowed delay between two events declared simultaneous, are user-dependent.

ext_description.p: the kind of accuracy that is applied. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'angular accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the maximum value for the absolute angle between two curve tangents or two surface normals for which the creating system assumes curve tangents or surface normals being identical The angular accuracy value can be used to determine the accuracy range for tangent continuous curve or surface connections.

'curvature accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the value for the term under which a system can assume that the two radii of curvature R1 and R2 are identical. The curvature accuracy value is used to determine the accuracy range for curvature continuous curve or surface connections Terms surrounded by the FORMULA symbols represent the absolute values of these terms.

'distance accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the distance under which two points can be considered as having the same location. The distance accuracy value defined for a is valid for all geometric elements of the .

ext_description.p: the character code that is used in the characterized object. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'binary': The document contains data in binary format;
'IEC 61286': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to IEC 61286;

'ISO 646': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to ISO 646;
The character set in ISO 646 is identical to the character set commonly known as ASCII
'ISO 6937': The coded character set used to encode the document data is according to ISO/IEC 6937;
'ISO 8859-1': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to ISO 8859-1; The character set in ISO 8859-1 is identical to the character set commonly known as LATIN-1.
'ISO 10646': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to ISO/IEC 10646.

ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

'ISO 10303-214': The document contains data in ISO 10303-214 format;
'TIFF CCITT GR4': The document contains data in TIFF CCITT GR4 format;

ext_description.p:
A GeneralShapeDependentProperty is a type of
that defines a user-defined characteristic of an object. The specified by a GeneralShapeDependentProperty is derived from geometry.
ext_description.note: The GeneralShapeDependentProperty may be used for the purpose of validation of geometric models.
ext_description.example: If a geometry model is exchanged between two partners, the calculation of various properties of the bodies, such as centre of mass, overall surface, or overall volume, is performed by originator and recipient. When comparing these set of values, the existence of deficiencies in the received model can be easily detected.

ext_description.p: the type of characteristic that is specified for an object. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'centroid': The identifies the centre point of the mass of a body. The relative position of this point within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation.; An example, where the use of this GeneralShapeDependentProperty with propertyType 'centroid' is used instead of the object , is the following: sometimes the GeneralShapeDependentProperty is calculated by some system at some point of time. But there are cases where the information, e.g., the GeneralShapeDependentProperty of a die, is transferred into a following stage, e.g., in order to perform a feasibility check, where there is only a simplified shape representation that does not allow to calculate the exact GeneralShapeDependentProperty. Yet, in this stage the information about the GeneralShapeDependentProperty is needed in order to check whether the transport of a die with a crane is feasible.
'surface area': The specifies the overall surface of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.;
'volume': The specifies the overall volume of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the value that is given for a particular characteristic.
the unit in which the GeneralShapeDependentProperty is expressed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A MatingDefinition is a type of . It is a view of a , defining the physical connection of two or more
objects. It includes technical information about the kind of connection. This information is independent from the hierarchical assembly structure.
the kind of mating, that is, how the items shall be mated together. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'bolted joint': Attachment of two or more items that are screwed together using screws, bolt nuts, and washers;
'brazing': Attachment of two or more items established by soldering or brazing;
'clasping': Attachment of two or more items established by using a clamp at one common outer border;
'clinching': Attachment of two or more items established by pressing these items together and stamping texture at the point of contact;
'clipping': Attachment of two or more items established by a clip ( e.g. fixing the inner door panel at the inner door plate);
'doweling': Attachment of two or more items using a pin that is fit into each of each part by pressing;
'flanging': Attachment of two or more items by crimping a projected length of one part over the edge of the other part;
'foam injection': Attachment of two or more items where foam is injected into a cavity to establish the connection;
'gluing': Attachment of two items established by adhesion material;
'laser-welding': Attachment of two or more items that are welded together using a laser technique;
'press fit': Attachment of two or more items obtained by forces resulting from the selected size tolerances;
'riveting': Attachment of two or more items that are riveted together at a certain spot using a rivet;

'sewing': Attachment of two or more items that are sewn together;
Upholstering cloth is sewn together to form a seat pillow.
'spot welding': Attachment of two or more items that are welded together at a certain welding spot;
'stapling': Attachment of two or more items at a certain spot using a nail or a wire stitch to establish the connection;
'welding': Attachment of two or more items by welding together with one weld bead.

ext_description.p:
the set of two or more
that reference a MatingDefinition instance as values of their attributes with name relating.

An OrganizationOrPersonInOrganizationAssignment is an object that associates an or a with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly. The OrganizationOrPersonInOrganizationAssignment shall not be used for the purpose of specifying a relationship between two objects, e.g., a succession in organizational responsibility. For these purposes, shall be used.

the identifier or set of identifiers for the OrganizationOrPersonInOrganizationAssignment.

ext_description.p: specifies the responsibility of the assigned or with respect to the object that it is applied to. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'author': The referenced object has been created by the assigned or . The author holds the copyright;
'classification officer': The assigned or is formally responsible for the classification of the referenced object;
'creator': The referenced object has been created by the assigned or ;
'custodian': The assigned or is responsible for the existence and integrity of the referenced object;
'customer': The assigned or acts as a purchaser or consumer of the referenced object;
'editor': One or more attributes have been modified by the assigned or ;
'id owner': The assigned or is the one responsible for the designation of an identifier;
'location': The assigned is the place where the referenced object can be found or where it takes place;
'manufacturer': The assigned or is the one who produces the actual (physical) object;
'owner': The assigned or owns the referenced object, and has final say over its disposition and any changes to it;

'read access: The assigned or neither has the right to modify any attributes of the referenced object, nor to modify, create or delete objects that are attached directly or indirectly to the referenced object;
'supplier': The assigned or is the one who delivers the actual (physical) object (e.g., a dealer);
'wholesaler': The assigned or is the one who is in the sales chain between the manufacturer and the supplier;

'write access': The assigned or has the right to modify the attributes of the referenced object, as well as to modify, create, or delete objects that are attached directly or indirectly to the referenced object.

A Part is a identification of definition of a part. It collects the definitional information of the versions of a part. A Part shall always be categorized as 'piece part', 'product', 'software', 'tool', or 'raw material' using a
.
ext_description.note: A Part does not represent an actual physical object of the real world.
A Part may be either a single piece part, an assembly of arbitrary complexity, a raw material, or a tool.
ext_description.example: In the context of cars, a Part may be the car as a whole, the assembly of the engine, the car body, a fender, the side window glass, grease, or a stamping die.
In the context of aeroplanes, a Part may be the air plane as a whole, the assembly of the engine, the body of the air plane, a fender, the side window glass, grease, or a stamping die.
ext_description.note: A Part is identified by an organization. The definition of the domain of uniqueness and the mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of Part id are outside the scope of this capability.

A Part may have zero or more versions. Versions of a Part are represented by the entity
.

A ProductClass is an identification of a set of similar products to be offered to the market. ProductClass objects that are related to each other by a
do not inherit any characteristics from each other.
ext_description.example:
The following figure depicts a detail of an example of a structure that is built up by ProductClass and
objects.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the level of the ProductClass in a hierarchical structure of ProductClass objects.
ext_description.example:
A high level ProductClass (levelType = 'enterprise') may be used to define all
and
objects for all ProductClass objects of an enterprise with several brands and companies. A second level ProductClass (levelType = 'platform') may be used to group all products that are based on the same technical concept (platform); these products may belong to different brands. A third level ProductClass (levelType = 'car family') may be used to group all products that have a common base and a fixed set of characteristics (specification categories). A fourth level ProductClass (levelType = 'car type') may represent products that are offered to the market; this level of ProductClass may be defined by the marketing department. A set of specifications sufficient to produce the car is associated with its ProductClass. Within this association, a distinction is made between standard characteristics (e.g. number of doors) and options that have to be chosen (e.g., outside colour) or that may be chosen by the customer (e.g., radio).
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that identifies a marketing category of the ProductClass. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words or group of words by which the market of the ProductClass is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

The intent of ProductConfiguration is the identification of one manufacturable object whereas the intent of

ext_description.example:
A ProductConfiguration that is associated with a
that identifies a family of diesel engines is intended to lead to the manufacture of a particular case of diesel engine, and the ProductConfiguration that is associated with a
that identifies a car family will lead to the manufacture of a car.
ext_description.note: The entity ProductConfiguration corresponds to the concept of configuration item defined, in some configuration management standards, as an item subject to configuration management.
ext_description.example: A ProductConfiguration may represent a component of a contracted product, onto which severe safety rules apply and for which configuration management is therefore rigorously applied.
ext_description.note: A ProductConfiguration may identify a variation of a , an entire , or some portion thereof.
A ProductConfiguration can be established prior to the existence of a corresponding product.

for some

available in the context of the

representing the car family may be without paint or painted in any available colour.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Requirement is an essential characteristic, condition, or capability that shall be met or exceeded by a system or a component to satisfy a contract, standard, specification, or other formally imposed document. The term "requirement" is used here in the sense that term is used in systems engineering and similar industrial domains. There may be many versions of a Requirement through . There may also be more than one domain-specific view of a given (using the entity). The Requirement entity is simply a placeholder for holding a unique requirement. Most associations and properties could be defined at the Requirement, or level - that is in the context of a domain. A requirement may be identified as "NOx emissions requirement", and uniquely identified as "Req2". Systems engineering tools and organizations may use differing identification mechanisms. Multiple identifiers may be managed in Requirement using the id attribute.

ext_description.p: the identifier or set of identifiers for the Requirement.
ext_description.note: This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .

ext_description.p: the words or set of words by which the Requirement is known.
ext_description.note: This attribute supports multiple names in different contexts as well as multi linguism.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the Requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the Requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the proxies of the Requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the versions of the Requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A RequirementAssignment is used to relate a (via or ) to data types representing the items (specified in ) which are affected by the requirement. A requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP" could be assigned to the data types which are used to represent the vehicle's engine.

the identifier or set of identifiers for the RequirementAssignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified. This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .

the or the which is assigned.
the item (specified in ) which has the requirement assigned to it.

A RequirementCollectionRelationship is a type of . It identifies a collection relationship that is used to relate a parent (collection) requirement to its member requirements. This provides a method for collecting together a set of requirements and treating them as a single requirement, whilst still being able to refer to individual requirements.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following class name shall be used:

ul.li: 'collection': the relationType specifies that the is a collection;

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A RequirementDecompositionRelationship is a type of . It identifies a decomposition relationship. This provides a method to represent a decomposition of requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A RequirementSatisfactionAssertion is a relationship between an item (specified in ) and a requirement (via or the ), asserting that the item satisfies the identified requirement. A data type used to represent a vehicle's engine with a power output of 160BHP could be asserted to satisfy a requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP".

the identifier or set of identifiers for the RequirementSatisfactionAssertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified. This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the RequirementSatisfactionAssertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the RequirementSatisfactionAssertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the date and the or the (via ) that has asserted the requirement satisfaction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that is satisfied by the RequirementSatisfactionAssertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the item (specified in ) that satisfies the requirement.
the requirement (via the or the ) that is satisfied.
A RequirementSequenceRelationship is a type of . It identifies a sequence relationship providing a method to link together , while introducing a particular order.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following class name shall be used:

ul.li: 'sequence': the relationType specifies that the is a sequence;

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A RequirementSourceAssociation is a relationship between a requirement (via the or the ) and the data types representing the source (specified in ) of the requirement. The source of the requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP" could be a document representing the findings of a market survey of sports car buyers.

ext_description.p: the identifier or set of identifiers for the RequirementSourceAssociation. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .

the classifications of the RequirementSourceAssociation. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the proxies of the RequirementSourceAssociation. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the item which is the source (specified in ) of the requirement.
the or the which is to be related to its source.

A RequirementTracingRelationship is a type of . It identifies a tracing relationship. A requirement on the performance of a catalytic converter in a car may be traced from a more general emissions requirement. A requirement may trace to many other requirements and vice versa - this is achieved by creating multiple instances of the tracing relationship entity.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following class name shall be used:

ul.li: 'tracing': the relationType specifies that the is a tracing relationship;

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A RequirementVersion identifies a particular version of a requirement. This entity is used to record different versions of a requirement. In this case, the word "version" implies "revision" - that is a particular release of a requirement. A given requirement might have versions 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and 2.0.

ext_description.p: the identifier or set of identifiers for the RequirementVersion.
ext_description.note: This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .

the views of the RequirementVersion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that the RequirementVersion is a version of.
A RequirementVersionRelationship is a type of relationship that is used to relate previous version (related) of a requirement to the version that replaces it (relating).
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the RequirementVersionRelationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the RequirementVersionRelationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A RequirementView provides a view of a requirement version relevant for one or more application domains. This view collects requirement data for specific engineering purposes. An engineer may have responsibility for collecting all requirements associated with the cooling of an engine - covering engine block, tubing, water pump, electric fan. Some requirements in a RequirementView might impact on different disciplines. Multiple RequirementView instances may be used to present different views of a given requirement for each discipline.
The definition of the requirement is represented by a set of definitional properties referenced from RequirementView.definitionalRepresentations. If more than one definitional property is provided each property shall be equivalent. Any other property that is associated with the RequirementView is assumed to be a non-defining property, such as an annotation etc. The requirement that the weight should be less than 4 Kgs can be represented by a string representation "weight must be 4Kg" and a numeric representation "4Kg" specified as a value with units.

ext_description.p: the identifier or set of identifiers for the RequirementView. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the RequirementView. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the RequirementView. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the set of objects in which this view of the is also relevant. The additionalContexts shall not contain the that is referenced as the initialContext.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the properties that define the requirement.
the in which this view of the has been designed primarily.
the proxies of the RequirementView. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the of which the RequirementView provides a characterization.

the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the RequirementViewRelationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the RequirementViewRelationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A SelectedPartOccurrence is a type of
that is the identification of the occurrence of an object that is either defined as a ,
or as a
and whose quantity depends on certain constraints.
ext_description.example: In a BOM where the exact amount of grease or glue can usually not be specified as a quantity, the specification of this grease or glue are examples for SelectedPartOccurrence objects.

To minimize the concentricity error of a wheel, weights are attached to the rim; this set of weights is a SelectedPartOccurrence. The quantity as well as the position of these weights depends on the concentricity behaviour of each particular wheel as manufactured and tested.

ext_description.p: the constraint that has to be evaluated for the SelectedPartOccurrence.
ext_description.example: 'as required for balance' and 'as required for lubrication' are examples for a criterion.

ext_description.p: the quantity of the part, tool or raw material foreseen as SelectedPartOccurrence. The quantity shall be of type or .
ext_description.note: If the quantity is to be specified as a minimum and/or a maximum, then or may be used.
ext_description.example:
The quantity of engine oil used in a car may be in the range of 3.7 to 3.9 litres. This is expressed using
as the quantity.

A SizeProperty is the specification of the size of a or of a object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a SizeProperty is referred by a , the size information is the sum of the sizes of all individual objects that are collected by this object, whereas in the case it is referred by a , the size information is the one of the individual objects that is referenced.

ext_description.p:
A Specification is a characteristic of a product. A Specification discriminates one product from other members of the same . A Specification refers to a
that completes the semantics of the Specification.
ext_description.note:
A Specification may be a characteristic of the members of more than one
using
objects.

A Specification in combination with a
may be used to define under which conditions a
is used in combination with a .
ext_description.example:
'coupe', 'hatch back', or 'sedan' are examples for specifications belonging to the
of type 'car body'. 'radio 1 with CD player' and 'radio 2 without CD player' are examples for specifications belonging to the
of type 'radio equipment'. 'disk brake' and 'drum brake' are examples for specifications belonging to the
of type 'braking system'.

specifies whether this Specification represents a package of Specification objects or not. Such a Specification combines those Specification objects that shall be offered to the market as a set. In the case where package is 'true', there shall be exactly one
per
considered, that refers to this Specification by its attribute . The Specification objects that are members of the package, shall be specified in the attribute

Usually the members of a package belong to distinct
objects.
ext_description.example: A sports package contains sports seats, a special steering wheel, special tyres and wheels. A winter package contains heated front seats, heated windshield washers, heated exterior mirrors, and special tyres.

objects serving the same purpose.
ext_description.example:
The category 'kind of drive' for the
objects 'front wheel drive' and 'rear wheel drive' or the category 'level of equipment' for the
objects 'standard', 'comfortable', and 'luxurious' are examples for SpecificationCategory objects.

specifies whether the
objects within the SpecificationCategory are mutually exclusive for the production of one particular product. A value of 'true' indicates that the referenced objects are mutually exclusive for the production of the particular product.
ext_description.example:
'safety equipment' is an example for a non mutually exclusive SpecificationCategory if, e.g., ABS and air bag are
objects in this category. 'engine' is an example for a SpecificationCategory with an implicitExclusiveCondition since usually only one engine can be mounted for power supply.
ext_description.note:
More complex conditions can be handled using
objects.

ext_description.p: A ViewContext is a grouping of an application domain and a life cycle stage. It identifies a universe of discourse suitable for the description of parts.
ext_description.note: Requirements and vocabularies vary among the industrial activity fields. This entity intends to identify such domains.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the ViewContext.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the identification of the applications for which an object may be relevant. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'assembly study': The object may be relevant for an assembly study;
'digital mock-up': The object may be relevant for digital mock-up;
'electrical design': The object may be relevant for the electrical design;
'mechanical design': The object may be relevant for the mechanical design;
'preliminary design': The object may be relevant for the preliminary design;
'process planning': The object may be relevant for the process planning;
'product support': The object may be relevant for the product support;
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any application domain.

ext_description.p: the general stage in the product life cycle to which the concerned items belong. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design': The concerned item belongs to the design phase of the life cycle;
'manufacturing': The concerned item belongs to the manufacturing phase of the life cycle;
'support': The concerned item belongs to the support phase of the life cycle;
'recycling': The concerned item belongs to the recycling phase of the life cycle;
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any life cycle stage.

ext_description.p: The combination of the applicationDomain and the lifeCycleStage shall be unique.
